name: Water Test Preparation
The drainage outlets should have temporarily blocked
Roof/Deck or Tanking to be flooded to check the integrity of the torch-on
On large roofs, sand bagging may be required to prevent the spread of water
Allow 50mm depth to be achieved across the area being tested
Flood test for a duration of not less than 24 hours

Nuraply 3PT and 3PTM Concrete Substrate Readiness Checklist received from Main Contractor

Concrete cured with curing membranes removed. Concrete substrate contains less
than 5% moisture content
Cavities and cracks filled with repair mortar, flushed off and cured.
Nuraswell installed to construction joints as per specification - located 50mm from rebar.
Concrete surface firm with any soft concrete or laitance removed.
All protrusions removed. Surface free from foreign matter

Mortar or bitumen fillets to all upstands and smooth 5mm radius
to all external edges

If terminating into a chase, pre-form the chase and ensure it’s
straight and 20mm deep.
Substrate clean, firm and suitable condition for laying the Nuralite system.

Concrete Substrate checklist completed before work commenced.

All corners and upstands incorporate reinforcing or under flashing

All non-standard details installed as per pre-approved specification (attach approved

Viking Tanking Checklist for Area:
Preparation
Substrate details specified
Substrate:
If substrate is Site Concrete, must be minimum of 45mm thick
If substrate is Sand/Gap Seven must be minimum 40mm compacted
There is boxing/formwork in the footings and around the perimeter
Builder has been made aware that they must not remove the boxing/formwork until the membrane has been torched or mechanically fixed to the top of the footing
All pipe penetrations held firm and on a minimum 2° downward slope
Bitumen fillet has been installed to the footing wall junction
All sharp objects or splashes removed from block concrete
There is enough room to work behind the wall and the bank battered or shored up so it is safe to work
If solvent primer is used, is there enough ventilation or is a charcoal filter mask required. Alternatively, use acrylic bitumen primer.
The area defined as confined working space
Wall and footing clean and dry so the primer can be applied
Pointing on the blockwork is flush
Control joints every 6m
The final height has been given
Final height specified:
The termination detail at the top of the membrane has been finalised
The termination bar has been sealed
The drain coil is in place
Protection is in place on the walls
Application
Product installed correctly, checked & reviewed - as per specification
Area left clean & tidy
